channel.title: Drafts on Practical Genomics Workshop
channel.description: Recent content in Drafts on Practical Genomics Workshop

item.title: RNA-seq Commands on MARCC
item.description: RSEM SAMtools Bowtie ssh gateway2.marcc.jhu.edu -l username@jhu.edu srun -p shared -c 1 --mem 1024 -t 30 --pty bash module load anaconda-python/3.6 source activate pg2018 cd ~/scratch # mkdir genomes cd genomes # cp ~/work/genomes/chr20.fa.gz . # gunzip chr20.fa.gz cp ~/work/genomes/hg19-iGenomes.gtf . cp ~/work/genomes/hg19.sizes . module load bowtie/1.2.2 rsem-prepare-reference --bowtie --gtf hg19-iGenomes.gtf chr20.fa chr20rsem cd .. cp -R ~/work/rawdata . cd rawdata ./doRename.sh ALIAS gunzip HUES64.mRNA*gz cd .. mkdir rna-seq cd rna-seq rsem-calculate-expression --output-genome-bam --paired-end --strandedness none .

item.title: Prep Work #3 - MARCC and Debugging R
item.description: Learning Objectives Log into MARCC Figure out two-factor authentication Build Bowtie2 index More practice with R Debug error messages Statistical thought (variance, difference) Install R packages annotatr ggbiplot ggplot2 dplyr rtracklayer Homo.sapiens bumphunter RTopper reactome.db GRanges Tasks Setup and test Google Authenticator Under development # Use your username, which should resemble lastname-temp ssh gateway2.marcc.jhu.edu -l username@jhu.edu # Connect to compute node interactively srun -p shared -c 1 --mem 1024 -t 30 --pty bash # Switch to high performance file system cd scratch # Create personal directory for genome datasets mkdir genomes cd genomes # Make a local working copy of chr20 from human hg19 cp ~/work/genomes/chr20.

item.title: Prep Work #4 - Conda, R, and Reading
item.description: Learning Objectives More practice with Unix Install programs with conda Create a metagene with deepTools scp k4.png Install IGV scp a .bw file More practice with R Paper to read Tasks Connect to MARCC Under development # Connect to compute node interactively srun -p shared -c 1 --mem 1024 -t 30 --pty bash # Load conda package manager module load anaconda-python/3.6 # Add bioconda for scientific software # .
